item.title: Overflowing bins outside 29 Navarino Road, 8th January
item.description:
Overflowing bins and litter in the front yard of 29 Navarino Road, for several days now. The bins have been torn open by foxes and it is now strewn all over their front yard and also into the street.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Navarino Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall on junction of Edgebury and Belmont Lane, 8th January
item.description:
Dangerous wall reported twice to council. Nothing done. Now wall has collapsed. Part of remaining wall still at a lean and liable to collapse. This is a busy route with young school children. Please can a barrier be placed around remaining wall immediately before someone is injured or worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Edgebury, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and detritus on Navarino Road 1-40, 8th January
item.description:
I had previously complained about litter ref: 8633221. The council has marked this issue as 'resolved'. This is definitely not resolved- I just walked down the street on 8 Jan morning and there is a huge amount of litter on the odd-numbered side.,
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Navarino Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fraudulent 'residents only'parking signs, 8th January
item.description:
The parking signs have been erected and some of the residents take it upon themselves to harass and threaten-mainly mothers with small children attending the children's centre, when parking there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Fallows Close, Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
